metadata.title: CVE-2021-39636 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In do_ipt_get_ctl and do_ipt_set_ctl of ip_tables.c, there is a possibleway to leak kernel information due to uninitialized data. This could leadto local information disclosure with system execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-120612905References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-kvm - 4.4.0-1104.113
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1014-azure - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.113').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.153').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
